Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:
¿Te apasionan los viajes , la cultura y el ocio y tienes ganas de participar en el crecimiento de la empresa Nº 1 en servicios turísticos en español?

Nuestro equipo no para de crecer y buscamos personas con talento e ilusión por desarrollarse. Somos un equipo joven, multicultural e innovador que entiende cada día como un desafío y una nueva oportunidad para crecer junto con la empresa.

Si quieres conquistar el mundo con nosotros, ¡te estamos esperando!

Buscamos una persona para unirse a nuestro Departamento de Data como Data Analyst Intern en nuestras oficinas en Madrid.

Como Data Analyst Intern en Civitatis, trabajarás junto con el resto del equipo de datos transformando grandes volúmenes de datos en insights accionables que impulsen la toma de decisiones estratégicas en toda la organización. Durante la beca, trabajarás junto con una de nuestras data analysts, colaborando estrechamente con varios departamentos para optimizar las operaciones y mejorar la experiencia del cliente. Desde el primer día, tu rol será clave para garantizar que Civitatis continúe siendo líder en el mercado de actividades turísticas, utilizando el análisis de datos para innovar y superar las expectativas de nuestros viajeros.

¿Cómo será tu día a día?


Desarrollar y mantener dashboards y reportes que proporcionen insights clave a diferentes áreas de negocio.
Analizar grandes conjuntos de datos para identificar tendencias, anomalías y oportunidades de mejora en el negocio.
Colaborar con el equipo de Data Science para implementar modelos predictivos y prescriptivos que mejoren la toma de decisiones.
Realizar análisis ad hoc para responder a preguntas específicas de los stakeholders.
Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con el equipo de IT para asegurar la calidad y accesibilidad de los datos.
Proponer y ejecutar mejoras en los procesos de recopilación y análisis de datos.
Participar en proyectos interdepartamentales para promover una cultura data-driven en la organización.
Asesorar a los equipos de marketing, ventas y operaciones sobre la interpretación y aplicación de los análisis de datos.



¿Qué buscamos?


Título universitario en Estadística, Matemáticas, Informática o campo relacionado.
Conocimientos avanzados en SQL, Python
Experiencia con herramientas de BI como PowerBI o Tableau.
Experiencia trabajando con grandes bases de datos y sistemas de almacenamiento de datos.
Curiosidad y muchas ganas de aprender cosas nuevas
Fuerte capacidad para traducir análisis complejos en recomendaciones claras y accionables
Inglés B2



¿Por qué Civitatis?


Formarás parte del líder mundial de reserva online de excursiones y visitas guiadas en español.
Espíritu joven, viajero y gran ambiente de trabajo. ¡20 nacionalidades!
Eventos de teambuilding (desayunos, “first thursday”, padel, senderismo, actividades deportivas, etc.).
¡Equipo sano, equipo feliz! Tenemos fruta siempre a mano y clases de yoga gratuitas.
Podrás disfrutar de nuestras más de 90.000 actividades con un super descuento.



¿Te sumas ?

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
If you have a passion for technology and thrive on innovative and diverse projects, you've found your ideal destination. If you don't know us yet, we are a global technology provider that offers a complete portfolio of solutions in Payment, Mobile and Identity Solutions. With a rich history spanning 65 years of global experience, we have built a solid legacy that continues to grow. Comprising over 4,000 dedicated professionals across 16 countries, we collaboratively work towards creating a more trustworthy and secure world.




From our Trusted Connectivity vertical, we offer solutions for the Telecommunications market, such as SIM Cards, eSIMs, Subscription Management, iSE, to secure connectivity and guarantee interoperability, connecting people, companies, and objects efficiently and with secure processes.




We are actively seeking a passionate Data Analyst ready to embark on a journey of continuous learning and professional growth with us. This role will be based in Madrid with a Hybrid work model.




In this role you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining the architecture and infrastructure necessary for extracting, transforming, and loading (ETL) data from various sources.




The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data engineering, a deep understanding of data pipelines, and proficiency in implementing scalable and efficient solutions and soft skills such as flexibility, communication and colaboration.




As a Data Analyst, you'll get to:




Key job responsibilities:




Data Architecture: Design, implement, and maintain scalable and robust data architecture to support the organization's data needs. Collaborate with analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into technical specifications.




ETL Development: Develop, optimize, and maintain ETL processes to ensure the efficient and accurate flow of data from source systems to data warehouses. Implement data cleansing, transformation, and enrichment techniques to ensure data quality and consistency.




Data Warehousing: Manage and optimize data warehouse structures for fast querying and reporting. Work with large datasets and implement strategies for partitioning, indexing, and optimizing query performance.




Data Integration: Integrate data from various sources, both internal and external, ensuring seamless data flow and consistency. Implement real-time data integration solutions to support business needs.




Data Modeling: Design and implement data models that align with business requirements and support analytical processes. Ensure data models are scalable, flexible, and meet performance requirements.




Monitoring and Maintenance: Implement monitoring systems to proactively identify and address data pipeline issues. Perform regular maintenance, updates, and optimizations to enhance data pipeline performance.




If you want this position to be yours, we would like you to have the following:




Graduated in Systems Engineering, Computer Science, Programming and/or Related Studies with Data Analysis, Business Intelligence, Machine Learning or related field
Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
English Communication skills, both verbally and in writing is a must.
Strong knowldege of programming skills in languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with database systems (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB).
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Kafka).
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and technologies (e.g., Snowflake, Redshift).
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.




What do we offer?




Join our team Valid by entering into technological and innovative projects within multicultural and multidisciplinary teams.
Flexibility. We have flexible hours and possibilities of working from home to improve the work-life balance of our employees.
We care about your well-being. You will have private medical insurance
Do you need a break? You will find our cafeteria at your disposal




If you believe this opportunity is a good fit for you, please either apply through LinkedIn or send your application to: hrtalent@valid.com




Join this great team and be part of our story!




Valid creates an inclusive environment for all employees. We are committed to building a company that reflects the diversity of the world that means fighting for equal opportunities based on a responsible and inclusive management of its human team with actions as non-discrimination concerning sex, age, race, sexual orientation, religion, education, social status, culture, or special needs such as illness or disability.

Title: BIG DATA JUNIOR RESEARCH ANALYST
Description:
BBVA Research analiza y hace previsiones sobre las principales tendencias económicas, financieras, digitales y geopolíticas a nivel mundial, así como sus implicaciones en la evolución macro y microeconómica y en los sistemas financieros de los países de interés para BBVA, sobre todo aquellos en los que tiene presencia.




Asimismo, el área elabora informes sobre estos temas de análisis para su difusión pública, y mantiene un dialogo permanente con los responsables de política económica en línea con su labor investigadora.




Busca permanentemente la excelencia en el análisis económico, que se logra con el empleo de herramientas analíticas de ultima generación, como la econometría y el análisis de Big Data.




En este marco, las responsabilidades de la persona serían de participación y apoyo, formándose a la vez, en todas aquellas tareas y objetivos de la unidad, pero más en particular:

Seguimiento de indicadores macroeconómicos, políticas monetarias y fiscales de las principales economías globales, con especial atención a la Eurozona.
Participación en proyectos de análisis económico más específicos relacionados con las tendencias a corto y largo plazo de determinadas variables económicas (fiscales, monetarias, comerciales, de mercado de trabajo, etc.).
Difusión de las tendencias y el análisis macroeconómico, especialmente de la economía europea, a través de documentos y presentaciones.




Cualificaciones:




Desde BBVA Research estamos buscando una persona que esté empezando su carrera profesional con buena formación técnica de carácter cuantitativo a nivel máster o cursos de doctorado, con familiaridad en el manejo de bases de datos y conocimiento de algunos lenguajes de programación (Python, R, Matlab, Stata, Rats...), aparte de buen manejo a nivel avanzado de hojas de cálculo. Se requiere un nivel mínimo de inglés B2-C1 tanto escrito como hablado.




Acerca de ti:




Estamos buscando a una persona bien formada en el ámbito técnico y con ganas de formarse en el análisis macroeconómico aplicado de grandes economías, y con interés en los debates económicos de actualidad, y que aporte además:

Capacidad de análisis y de síntesis.
Capacidad de trabajo en equipo (habilidad para trabajar en un entorno global con contacto constante con diversas geografías).
Capacidad de comunicación oral y escrita en español e inglés.
Capacidad de organización y gestión de proyectos para gestionar diferentes tareas con plazos acotados.
Proactividad y autonomía para desarrollar las diferentes líneas de trabajo.




Se ofrece un contrato formativo de un año de duración.

Title: Analista de Datos Junior - Yield Management
Description:
En PRISA Media buscamos un Analista de Datos Junior para unirse al equipo de Yield Management. La persona seleccionada será responsable de analizar el rendimiento de las posiciones publicitarias del grupo, tanto desde la perspectiva del inventario como de la demanda. Deberá identificar las áreas de mejora, proponer soluciones para optimizar el rendimiento y replicar casos de éxito. Además, colaborará en la realización de previsiones semanales de ingresos y en el cierre de facturación de ingresos publicitarios.




Responsabilidades principales:




Análisis del rendimiento publicitario: Evaluar y analizar el rendimiento de las posiciones publicitarias, identificando qué espacios funcionan bien y cuáles necesitan optimización.
Análisis de la demanda: Monitorear el rendimiento de las distintas plataformas de monetización, identificando cuáles generan más o menos ingresos para la compañía.
Propuesta de soluciones: Interpretar los datos y proponer soluciones proactivas para mitigar problemas y replicar estrategias exitosas.
Mantenimiento de datasets y cuadros de mando: Colaborar en el mantenimiento y la actualización de los datasets y cuadros de mando en Power BI, garantizando su correcto acceso y diseño.
Previsiones y cierre de ingresos: Participar en la elaboración de previsiones semanales de ingresos y colaborar en el cierre mensual de facturación con el equipo financiero.
Optimización de ingresos: Realizar el seguimiento y análisis de los ingresos provenientes de plataformas de monetización, optimizando floor prices y evaluando métricas como precios, pujas, bid rate y coverage.
Peticiones ad hoc: Responder a solicitudes específicas de análisis por parte del equipo comercial, editores o nivel ejecutivo.
Apoyo al equipo de finanzas: Ayudar en el cierre de facturación de los ingresos publicitarios
Colaboración y comunicación: Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con el Director de Yield y el resto del equipo para garantizar la optimización continua del rendimiento publicitario.

Requisitos:




Grado en Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería, Economía o afines.
Experiencia previa en análisis de datos, preferentemente en el área de publicidad digital o monetización.
Comprensión básica de herramientas y técnicas de análisis de datos.
Conocimientos avanzados de la suite de aplicaciones empresariales de Microsoft (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
1+ años de experiencia utilizando SQL.
Experiencia con herramientas de visualización de datos, preferentemente Power BI y Looker.
Habilidad para interpretar datos y proponer soluciones prácticas.
Capacidad para trabajar en un entorno dinámico y manejar múltiples tareas de manera efectiva.
Fuertes habilidades analíticas y de resolución de problemas.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación, tanto para trabajar en equipo como para presentar resultados a diferentes niveles de la organización.




Se valorará positivamente:




Experiencia previa en Yield Management o en análisis de inventario publicitario.
Conocimiento de herramientas y plataformas como adservers, plataformas de venta programática (SSPs), Adomik, , entre otras.
Experiencia trabajando con herramientas de análisis web, un plus (Adobe Analytics o Google Analytics)
Experiencia en la elaboración de previsiones y cierres de ingresos.




Ofrecemos:




Oportunidad de desarrollo profesional en un equipo dinámico y en crecimiento.
Entorno de trabajo colaborativo y centrado en la innovación.
Participación en proyectos de alto impacto en el área de monetización publicitaria.

Title: Mid-Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a motivated Data Analyst ready to join our venture-backed B2B SaaS company and dig out all the hidden gems in our internal data. With around 100 employees, our team is mainly based in Malaga, Spain, but we are incorporated in the US and the EU (with our top-corp registered in Delaware). You can choose where you want to work from because the location doesn't matter, you do.




What is Plytix?




Plytix is the world's leading Product Information Management (PIM) platform for Small and Medium-Sized Businesses (SMBs). Plytix PIM helps companies store and organize product information ranging from descriptions and images to prices, and other specifications, in one place. Essentially, it's a handy tool that makes managing and updating product data a whole lot easier.







About our Culture




This is where you’d typically see a long paragraph of boring text that no one reads, peppered with corporate buzzwords that don’t mean anything. But Plytix is no typical company so we’ll spare you that. Instead, watch this video, and if you like what you see, keep scrolling.







What’s the opportunity?




This is your chance to come and work for a high-growth B2B SaaS company based in the US, Denmark, and Spain. Plytix is backed by Tier 1 investors, such as Tiger, and is already a global industry leader within PIM—one of the fastest-growing verticals in the retail industry.




We're seeking a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our growing team. In this role, you'll get an unique opportunity of collaborating with practically all departments, including Engineering, Finance, Product, Marketing, Customer Success and Sales. Your mandate will be to collect, consolidate and analyze data, to then present findings that drive decision-making and product improvements.







What will you be doing?




You will be our data wizard and the go-to person for everything related to KPI definition and reporting. You will be working very closely with different department managers and founders, to understand data needs and provide solutions and useful insights that will make a difference in the decision making process. Your main responsibilities will include but aren’t limited to:




Data Collection and Management

Design and implement processes for data collection, cleaning, and integration from various sources, using APIs and other methods where needed.
Manage, analyze, and interpret complex datasets to provide actionable insights.
Ensure data quality and reliability.




Data Analysis

Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
Utilize statistical methods to analyze and interpret data sets.
Develop KPIs and metrics to track business performance.




Business Intelligence reporting

Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that provide meaningful insights to stakeholders.
Present data findings and recommendations to stakeholders effectively.




Product Analytics

Assist in identifying key product outcome metrics and their correlation to business outcomes.
Conduct behavioral analytics to track feature usage and identify improvement opportunities.
Help design and analyze product experiments to optimize product decisions.




Cross-functional Collaboration

Work closely with Product, Marketing, Customer, Sales, and Finance teams to understand their data needs
Provide data-driven insights and recommendations for product and process improvements
Support the improvement of data reliability in our backoffice systems







After 1 month:

You have been introduced to the entire organization and all processes in the departments you need to be collaborating with. You have been presented with the state of the art regarding data collection and reporting and you already have an understanding of what’s needed in order to get the best out of our data and to achieve stellar reporting.




After 3 months:

At this point, you have designed and established a convenient data warehouse where all the previously scattered data from different sources will finally live together. You have already implemented scripts to extract data from some tools and have started to create initial dashboards and reports for key stakeholders. You've begun to identify areas where data quality can be improved and have proposed solutions to address these issues.




6 months in:

By now, you have fully integrated data from all major sources into the data warehouse. You've developed comprehensive dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights to various departments. You've established strong relationships with team leaders across the organization and are actively contributing to data-driven decision-making processes. You've also started to implement more advanced analytics techniques, such as predictive modeling, to provide deeper insights into product usage and customer behavior. Your work has begun to directly impact strategic decisions and product improvements.




Who will you be working with?




You’ll be the first Data Analyst to join the company, meaning you’ll potentially become a key role in the organization, and as such you’ll work closely with different department directors and the founders.




The ideal candidate will:




Have 3-5 years of experience in data analysis or a similar role for a SaaS company
Have strong proficiency in SQL and experience with data warehousing concepts
Experience with data visualization tools
Experience with APIs and data collection methods
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Have proven learning background in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field
Strong communication skills and ability to present complex data in an understandable way
Familiarity with product analytics and SaaS metrics
Be detail-oriented and organized
Speak and write native-level English







Nice to have:

Knowledge of Python or R for data analysis and scripting
Familiarity with statistical analysis and experimental design
A dog… We love dogs :)







To Apply:

Fill out the form and submit your video presentation or send them by email to hr@plytix.com.

Video presentation: for an explanation of the video requirement see this video 👉🏼 https://bit.ly/3OF1c8u







Why work at Plytix?




Voted Spains #1 employer by Great Place to Work®
Be a part of a welcoming culture with bright, friendly people from around the world
Have a purpose and plenty of opportunities to grow from day one
Work from home or from our offices in the center of Malaga
Competitive full-time salary
Enjoy free catered lunches and unlimited ice cream when working from the office in Malaga
Private health insurance covered by Plytix
More perks (differs depending on which office you belong to)







PLYTIX is a company committed to diversity and equality. Therefore, all our selection processes guarantee equal opportunities for all candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, origin, nationality, age, disability, sexual orientation, and gender identity. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications.







We are committed to managing your personal information with care and in accordance with our privacy policy. To learn more about how we handle your data, please click HERE

Title: PRODUCT DATA ANALYST
Description:
Si te gustan los animales... ¡Únete al grupo líder de los animales de compañía!




El grupo Iskaypet lo formamos más de 3000 profesionales de diferentes áreas que compartimos la pasión por los animales de compañía y por nuestro trabajo.




En fuerte crecimiento, actualmente operamos en España y Portugal desde tres oficinas corporativas en Madrid, Málaga y Oporto; desde más de 300 tiendas Tiendanimal y Kiwoko, y desde más de 80 clínicas y consultorios veterinarios Clinicanimal y Kivet.




Desde todas las áreas de la empresa compartimos el mismo objetivo: mejorar la vida de nuestros animales de compañía y sus familias.




Queremos sumar a una persona para que se una a nuestro equipo de Producto / Tecnología de las oficinas de Madrid o Málaga.




Tu misión será democratizar la información del E-Commerce, trabajando dentro del equipo de Producto para transformar la data en insights clave para la toma de decisiones en la estrategia digital. Darás soporte a los distintos equipos interdisciplinarios con Negocio y tecnología, influenciando el roadmap del desarrollo del producto y el conocimiento sobre nuestro negocio. Evangelizarás a la compañía sobre la cultura Data Driven para fomentar la toma de decisiones basadas en datos.




¿Cuáles serán tus responsabilidades?




Generar insights basados en datos para la toma estratégica de decisiones para el negocio, el desarrollo del producto digital y para mejorar la experiencia de nuestros clientes.
Explotar diversas fuentes de datos para obtener la información necesaria para los análisis.
Coordinar proyectos interdisciplinarios a raíz de las propuestas generadas en base a datos.
Trabajar codo a codo con Product Managers y Tech Leads dando soporte analítico y generando insights necesarios para toma de decisiones.
Desafiarás el status quo proponiendo soluciones alternativas que mejoren la eficiencia.
Estandarizarás y contribuirás en la mejora continua de la infraestructura de reporting, generando nuevas y mejores formas de entender nuestro negocio y producto.

¿Qué tenemos para ofrecerte?




Y además gracias a nuestro programa #happyiskaylife encontrarás:




- Horario flexible de entrada y salida.




- Entorno Petfriendly: ¡Tráete tu mascota a la oficina!




- Sistema de trabajo híbrido: teletrabaja el 50% de la jornada.




- Jornada intensiva cada viernes y los meses de julio y agosto.




- Posibilidad de retribución flexible (ticket restaurante, guardería y transporte)

Title: Data Analyst (dpto. fraude)
Description:
Somos una de las entidades financieras de referencia de crédito al consumo en el mercado español. Con 30 años de historia en nuestro país, hemos acompañado a más de dos millones y medio de clientes para hacer realidad sus proyectos.. Estamos respaldados por el grupo Crédit Mutuel, el cuarto banco más importante en Francia, y el holding Argosyn. Ambos nos proporcionan el soporte financiero y tecnológico necesario para diseñar, vender y gestionar una amplia gama de productos de crédito al consumo, préstamos personales, tarjetas, líneas de crédito, soluciones de pago y seguros.




Estamos buscando para nuestra oficina ubicada en Cornellà de Llobregat a un/a Data Analyst. Tu misión consistirá en realizar las extracciones y análisis necesarios, con las herramientas estadísticas existentes, para el control y seguimiento del fraude.




Entre tus funciones y responsabilidades:




Recopilar, limpiar y analizar datos históricos relacionados con el fraude u otros indicadores relevantes relacionados, para identificar patrones de fraude y relaciones entre variables.
Consolidar la información estadística de las bases de datos garantizando la calidad, la fiabilidad y la coherencia del dato con el objetivo de dotar a la Dirección de Fraude herramientas que permitan el análisis de la cartera.
Realización de pruebas y validación rigurosa de los modelos existentes, para asegurar su precisión y fiabilidad; puede incluir validación de datos, pruebas de hipótesis calibración de parámetros y evaluación de precisión predictiva.
Utilizando técnicas estadísticas y matemáticas, participa en el desarrollo de modelos que permiten evaluar y cuantificar el riesgo de fraude.
Dotar al área de estrategias para prevenir el fraude.
Realizar análisis e informes con el objetivo de dar respuesta a las necesidades de información para la realización de estudios tanto en proyectos internos del Grupo como en proyectos de otras direcciones que tengan impacto en la gestión del fraude.




¿Qué buscamos en ti?




Formación universitaria en Matemáticas, Estadística, Economía o Ingenierías.
Experiencia mínima de 3 años como Data Analyst en entidades financieras, preferentemente en el departamento / área de Fraude.
Experiencia participando en proyectos transversales, aportando conocimiento y soluciones desde la perspectiva del fraude.
Conocimiento técnico: SAS o SQL avanzado, Excel avanzado.
Muy valorable conocimiento de herramientas de gestión del fraude (ThreatMetrix,...).
Buen nivel de inglés y/o francés.
Persona con gran capacidad analítica, rigurosa con el dato, credibilidad técnica y buenas habilidades comunicativas para trabajar transversalmente con las áreas y proyectos de Grupo.




¿Qué te ofrecemos?




Incorporarte a una multinacional del sector financiero en pleno proceso de Transformación.
Formar parte de un equipo dinámico formando parte de proyectos transversales.
Amplias posibilidades de desarrollo profesional.
Modelo de trabajo híbrido con 2 días de teletrabajo a la semana.
Un completo paquete de compensación que incluye: contrato estable, salario fijo, variable, tickets restaurant y otros beneficios sociales.

Title: Associate Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
At Beyond, we power the business of Short Term Rentals through our cutting-edge, full-stack Revenue Management System. Venture-backed, we pioneered this space and have grown to be the globally dominant leader - obsessed with delivering value and performance to our customers. And the way we've been able to achieve those heights is our belief that People are the most important part of any business - starting with ours. We employ over 170 Beyonders across the globe who share in our commitment to making Beyond the best place to work.

It's with that in mind that Beyond is looking to add an Associate Business Intelligence Analyst. Reporting to our Director, Revenue Operations, you will play a critical role in delivering actionable and meaningful metrics to both internal and external stakeholders. Your primary objective will be to provide comprehensive insights that enable our internal teams to gain a holistic understanding of how our products and services connect with each other, and with our customers.

To excel in this position, you should possess a strong technical background and a proven track record in developing reporting, business intelligence, and data solutions. We're looking for someone hands-on, results-oriented, and eager to work cross-functionally.

Before reading further…

Beyond is passionate about diversity and cultivating our team's potential. If you're hungry for a good opportunity, but don't meet every point in this job description, please apply anyway!

As our Associate Business Intelligence Analyst, you'll be responsible for:


Data, Data, & more Data - Analyze & optimize our current data transformation pipelines. Create new data models to support business insights & monitor data quality.
Technical Partnership - Partner closely with other Tech, Product and Data engineering teams on the day-to-day execution of analytics, projects & new data initiatives.
Harvesting insights - Enabling effective decision-making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.
Business Expertise - Leveraging a deep, data-driven understanding of the key drivers and metrics underpinning Beyond's products and business lines to draw insights and make recommendations that will help the company grow and scale effectively.
Showing the way to key stakeholders - Conduct deep-dive analysis with complex SQL queries and translate requirements into effective & innovative data visualizations and solutions in Mode. Partnering closely with our GTM, Finance & Product teams to support their business objectives through analysis.


So what kind of person are we looking for in this role? The person who will be successful in this role will be an:


Innovator - Insights without action are lost opportunities and you regularly seek new information, try new approaches, and want to increase the pace of learning
Storyteller - You love telling stories with data, and have a playbook for how to bring people along in the process
Explorer - You seek information that challenges assumptions and delight in finding insights that are not obvious.
Advisor - You have the ability to distill and share key data and insights that lead to better decision-making and strategy


Now that we've told you what the job looks like, here are the qualifications we're looking for in a candidate:


2+ years of experience working in a Business Intelligence / Analytics environment.
Strong data modeling & proficiency SQL skills with experience working with complex & large data sets.
Experience harnessing data from multiple sources and making it usable and accessible for non-technical users.
Hands-on experience with data transformation tools, query engines and data visualization tools (dbt, airflow & Mode are what we use)
Experience articulating business questions, and using available data to find answers that translate into business recommendations.
You have exceptional business intuition and conceptual thinking, with the ability to readily map business processes to the appropriate metrics.
Experience with dbt / Python is a plus


So what can you expect after you apply? Your application will be personally reviewed by a member of the Beyond hiring team and if there is a match in your experience and the role, you will:


Have a video conversation with someone on our Recruiting team. This is a high-level conversation about your experience and interest, but also an opportunity for you to learn more about us
Interview with our Director, Revenue Operations & BI
Complete a technical assignment
Meet with our team for deeper dive video conversations
Interview with our Chief Revenue Officer
Interview with our Chief Technology Officer/Cofounder


Company Values:

We are serious about our core values: We Care, We Are On the Same Team, We Inspire Trust, We Go Beyond, We Ship It, We're Curious. If those resonate with you, and you're ready to work with a team that lives and breathes those values, we want to hear from you.

Benefits:

Beyond offers a wide variety of benefits like: stock options, unlimited PTO, private health insurance and more! You can learn more about our benefits by visiting our careers site!

We Care about Diversity, Equity and Inclusion:

Beyond is committed to building a workplace that attracts humans of all genders, ethnicities, backgrounds, statuses and lifestyles. At our core, we care about our people and encourage every employee, partner and applicant to share their whole self with us. We are respectful of and empathetic towards different viewpoints, and believe that our ability to help short term rental managers succeed relies on us building a dynamic and diverse team. Whoever you are, you can Belong @ Beyond.

Any communication regarding job openings, interviews and/or offers will come from our @beyondpricing.com email domain

Please review our GDPR Statement here.

Title: BI Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
This role is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining business intelligence solutions using Microsoft Power BI. The role involves analyzing and interpreting complex data sets to provide actionable insights that support business decision-making and enhance organizational performance. The role also includes developing automated processes and integrating analytics to drive efficiencies and innovation. Effective communication and collaboration with business stakeholders are essential to ensure alignment and successful presentation of developed solutions.

Responsibilities


Develops and maintains Power BI reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate data-driven insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Analyzes complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform business decisions.
Designs and implements automated data processing and analytics workflows to improve efficiency and accuracy.
Partners with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into actionable BI solutions.
Ensures data quality and integrity by implementing robust data governance and validation processes.
Collaborates with data engineering teams to build and maintain data pipelines, ensuring seamless integration of data from various sources.
Leads and mentors a team of BI developers, providing guidance, training, and support to junior team members.
Communicates project progress, challenges, and solutions to stakeholders effectively, ensuring alignment and timely delivery.
Represents the BI team in cross-functional projects, driving the implementation of BI solutions and ensuring their alignment with business objectives.
Continuously evaluates and improves existing BI methodologies, staying updated with the latest trends and technologies in the field.


Education & Experience Recommended


Four-year or Graduate Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics, or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience.
Typically has 4-7 years of work experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a related field, or an advanced degree with 3-5 years of work experience.


Requirements


Python
AI/ML Knowledge


Knowledge & Skills


Microsoft Power BI
SQL (Programming Language)
Data Analysis
Data Visualization
Data Warehousing
Business Intelligence
Data Governance
Statistical Analysis
Effective Communication
Project Management
Stakeholder Management
Results Orientation
Learning Agility
Customer Centricity


Impact & Scope


Impacts multiple teams and may act as a team or project leader, providing direction to team activities and facilitating information validation and team decision-making processes.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (100% remote in Poland or Spain)
Description:
Welcome to the good side of tech 👋


You might have heard about us, but with a different name: Doctoralia. It all started 10 years ago, when we asked ourselves: is anyone in healthcare thinking about patients? We jumped in and we empowered patients by giving them access to leave and read reviews about their visit. We then provided doctors with the technology to manage bookings easily and save time, so they could devote themselves to what they always wanted: treating patients. And today is the day in which we ask you: will you join us in the next step of making the healthcare experience more human?


Docplanner at scale


We are leaders in 13 countries so far, and more than 90 million patients trust us every month. Almost 300.000 specialists believe in us and our product, and so do leading venture capital funds such as Point Nine Capital, Goldman Sachs Asset Management and One Peak Partners. And yet, employing over 2.700 people all over the globe, we managed to keep the startup-mindset we started with over 10 years ago.




Job Description



Our primary objective is to assist business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing global reports as the primary and most reliable source of information. A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.


How would you be impacting our mission?


Derive facts from data and translate them into actionable insights and recommendations.
Support the business with identifying opportunities and making intelligent, data-driven decisions. You will execute end-to-end BI projects and be the main point of contact for the internal stakeholders.
Use (and develop!) a global database.
Create, automate and visualize reports and analysis for both top management and local teams (such as Finance, Sales, Customer Success, Marketing, Customer Experience).
When you become independent in the role you will have a chance to develop prediction/classification models using Python/R.
Work with Redshift, Git, Tableau, Airflow daily.



Qualifications



What will help you thrive?


Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights, either in commercial or academic setting (must have).
Knowledge of Python/R and desire to expand your knowledge.
Experience with statistical modeling and descriptive statistics.
Experience in partnership with internal stakeholders.
Experience in leading and executing end to end BI projects.
Very good level of business English.

Which skills are ‘bonus points’?


Have a degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Are able to take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens.
Are open to cooperating with a lot of people from many teams in different countries.
Like to see instant effects of your work.
Are careful, diligent and detail-oriented.



Additional Information



What will you get in return?


Let’s talk money


Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh, which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings;
Share options plan after 6 months of working with us.

True flexibility and work-life balance


Remote first in one of our legal entities or hybrid work model in one of our office locations;
Flexible working hours;
Paid time off according to your location of work;
Additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate).

Health comes first


Health insurance according to your location of work;
Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling.

What does the recruitment process look like?


A 30-minute meeting with Rosario Corti - Head of International Talent Acquisition
A 60-minute meeting with Wiktor Kulikowski - BI Manager
Business Case - Prepare a Business Case and present it within the final chat (60 minutes) with Wiktor

We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you’re reading, there’s a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we’re lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you’ve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other.

Title: Data Analyst Intern - Regional Operations (They/He/She)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.


We have an ‘’office-first’’ culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do!
We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don’t shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift!
We work with high intensity and have fun along the way. We also celebrate the wins (a lot!).
We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work.


💪Our career development philosophy.


We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential.
We take ownership of our career development. We don’t believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams!
We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope.


🤝Our commitment to being a force for good.


Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact.
We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives.
We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities.


We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Glovo is looking for an Data Operations intern to work in our team in Barcelona. Are you passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on? Do you want to evolve in one of the fastest growing Start-ups of Europe, building a product that will change people's day-to-day and disrupt the on-demand market.

THE JOURNEY


Analyze data generated by our core operations in order to improve our stakeholder experience (Couriers, Users and Partners);
Come up with data insights to help improve most important KPIs for the whole Country (e.g., Delivery time, Cancellations, efficiency, Cross departmental projects... );
Proactively spot inefficiencies, understand root causes and propose data driven actions;
Process standardization: Improve processes on behalf of Glovers through projects (when necessary)
KPIs tracking: Manage scheduling, attendance and general administration of Info-Sessions while supporting daily operations through operational supervision and analysis of KPIs ∙ Communicate effectively with the local Operations Manager on customer support processes and operations
Work close with the other departments to monitor any structural process optimization;
Give life to your craziest ideas and have an immediate impact thinking out of the box!


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Bachelor in Engineering, Maths or any technological domain
Passionate about analytics: you enjoy deep diving into problems to find the root cause
Problem-solving skills: no problem is too small or too big
Excel proficiency
Experience in SQL is a must
Professional English
An empathetic, inclusive and curious attitude


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: BI Analyst Intern
Description:
This job is with Criteo, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.

What You'll Do

The Global Reporting Team's mission is to identify, define, produce, and automate sales/business/finance performance reporting portfolio. As the scope of the GRT is so wide, this is a unique opportunity not only to develop your technical skills, but also to learn more about different areas of our business and make an impact, while working in a fast paced environment.

Responsibilities

Criteo and our stakeholders are constantly finding new ways to innovate, and our reporting suite is critical for tracking progress. As an intern, alongside the rest of the team you will be responsible for :


Working with stakeholder to analyze and understand their business needs to translate them into technical requirements
Building, running and updating existing reports based on the company needs and transformations
Exploring, validating and fixing data issues to provide high quality service to Criteos
Maintaining and improving processes (specification, procedures, and user training material).


Our objective is that by the end of the internship, you have developed the skills and experience to work in data.

Who You Are


Degree from a business or quantitative field
Experience in Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, etc.), PowerPoint, SQL, and BI restitution tools such Power BI (or equivalent)
Must be eager to learn, proactive and analytical
Excellent communication skills in English (spoken and written)
You are versatile, self-driven, detail-oriented, and hands-on
You value teamwork and building rapport with individuals
You have a demonstrated interest in Internet and technology


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data Specialist (Intern)
Description:
Job Description

This is a remote position.

Are you a trailblazer looking for a new challenge in a pioneering organization with global impact? Are you looking to boost your professional growth, being part of an emerging company? Then Eticas is for you!

At Eticas, we are global leaders in Responsible and Fair AI on a mission to protect people in technology processes. Over the last decade, we have developed cutting-edge methodologies and tools to identify and mitigate bias, promote fairness, and ensure AI and ML algorithms obtain more accurate results.

With our flagship AI Auditing product, ITACA, Eticas is at a crucial point in its history, and we need a winning team to execute this plan and assert ourselves as pioneers in deploying commercial auditing solutions.

What will your role look like?

As a Data Specialist Intern, you will support our AI auditing team performing sociotechnical analysis, reviewing and analyzing data, coding and contributing to the creation of audit reports, publications, and other audit-related content.

This internship provides a unique opportunity to collaborate with a diverse and motivated team and help shape a more ethical future in technology.

Your Key Responsibilities

Participate in building the scientific underpinnings of our groundbreaking tools to measure, monitor, and mitigate bias in AI.

Participate in the implementation of quantitative methods, including data collection, coding, developing metrics, and analysis of results.

Support our audits using both statistical tools and qualitative analysis methods to perform sociotechnical analysis which are applicable in real life.

Collaborate with team members to develop the existing products and create new ones based on the needs of the clients and market demand.

Managing project documentation and communicating with stakeholders and clients.

Stay updated on the latest developments in AI auditing and research to inform project activities.

Requirements

Must-have skills:

Fluency in English, both written and spoken.

Completed or in-progress degree in a relevant field such as social sciences (with a focus on quantitative methods), statistics, data science, computer science, or related disciplines.

Experience in R or similar coding tools (Python).

Solid understanding of statistics and experience with statistical analysis software.

Experience or interest in conducting research related to AI/ML, social media recommender systems, ethical technology, or algorithmic auditing.

Excellent written communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively as well as independently.

Enthusiasm for social change and a commitment to ethical considerations in technology.

Experience working in remote and cloud-based environments.

Experience in working in environments such as Agile, Scrum or similar methodologies.

A lifelong learning attitude.

Benefits

What Eticas can offer you:

We are pioneers of the sector in the world, so our day-to-day is never a routine. We embrace the challenge of learning every day how to improve in our roles and how to add value to others!

We work as a community, learning together from an emerging business. You will always count on us! We are diverse in technical and management profiles, whose motivation and knowledge we learn from every day.

We want to positively impact the world. You will work in a company that wants to generate global change, in pursuit of justice and responsibility.

We believe in independence in carrying out our tasks. We pursue our goals and insist on high standards.

We encourage and embrace diverse backgrounds because we understand the value of diversity to increase our value as a company.

Who will you be collaborating with?

Gemma, Founder and CEO at Eticas

Arancha Cienfuegos, Chief Operations Officer at Eticas

Ariane Aumaitre, Lead Data Scientist at Eticas

If, after everything we have explained, you think you are the best candidate, send an email to ****** with your CV and a cover letter explaining why you are interested in working with us and what you can contribute to Eticas and the above role.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ECI is the leading global provider of managed services, cybersecurity, and business transformation for mid-market financial services organizations across the globe. From its unmatched range of services, ECI provides stability, security and improved business performance, freeing clients from technology concerns and enabling them to focus on running their businesses. More than 1,000 customers worldwide with over $3 trillion of assets under management put their trust in ECI.

At ECI, we believe success is driven by passion and purpose. Our passion for technology is only surpassed by our commitment to empowering our employees around the world.

The Opportunity:

The Data Analyst will be responsible for overseeing the development and deployment of Power BI reports and their underlying datasets, to provide analytics to a wide range of functional teams at ECI. This person will lead projects to bring and enhance visibility into key enterprise metrics and drive action based on the resulting insights. The successful candidate should be skilled at asking probing questions for clarity and be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical audiences. This role requires advanced proficiency working with complex SQL queries.

The ideal candidate is a motivated, detail-oriented individual who is equally comfortable with back-end data structures, visualization, and storytelling.

This is an Onsite role.

What you will do:


Reporting: Create PowerBI reports and dashboards that provide insights to stakeholders
Data Modeling: Design and develop data models that support business requirements
Data Vizualization: Create visualizations that help stakeholders understand complex data insights
Deployment: Oversee the QA and deployment of reporting made available for consumption; Coordinate and assist with User Acceptance Testing, conducting demos, participating in stakeholder reviews, as well as assuming the role of post-release Subject Matter Expert
Data Integrity: Communicate frequently when reports are under maintenance
Requirement Gathering: Responsible for working with other groups to efficiently define requirements and support their business objectives; these requirements will be used for tasks assigned to this role and tasks assigned to data analysts
User Engagement: Engage with stakeholders to analyze and isolate root cause of data issues and drive data cleansing efforts
Documentation: Maintain SharePoint knowledge base documentation related to solution requirements, data flow diagrams, business glossary and data lineage


Who you are:


Should have 4+ years of relevant experience.
Education/Experience: College diploma or university degree in the field of computer science, information science, management information systems, or business administration or a related field or equal years of experience
Data Analysis: Proven track record of analyzing large datasets and extracting meaningful insights from them
Statistics and Databases: Firm understanding of statistics and databases to be able work with data effectively
Problem Solving: Ability to identify problems and develop solutions that can help the org achieve its goals
Communication: Strong communication skills to be able to explain complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders
Collaboration: Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and collaborate with other departments to achieve common goals
Change Management: experience creating reports in a sandbox before pushing to Production
Dedicated to innovation of existing operational processes
Ability to effectively prioritize and negotiate tradeoffs with stakeholders
Proficiency with ETL methodologies & syncing data across disparate systems
4+ years related experience and building analytic solutions
4+ years working with SQL and databases
Experience navigating large datasets
Exceptional at finding trends in data
Experience applying statistical techniques to understand and quantify the relationships between metrics to help differentiate between correlation and causation


Bonus points if you have:


Working Python experience, a plus


ECI’s culture is all about connection - connection with our clients, our technology and most importantly with each other. In addition to working with an amazing team around the world, ECI offers a competitive compensation package and so much more! If you believe you’d be a great fit and are ready for your best job ever, we’d like to hear from you!

Chegou o momento de te desafiares a sair da tua zona de conforto fazendo parte de um grande projeto? Vem trabalhar connosco e potenciar ainda mais o teu desenvolvimento!

Terás uma experiência profissional que te irá inspirar, ao lado de outros talentos como tu, a transformar o mundo como o conhecemos: a torná-lo mais humano, eficiente e tecnológico. Estão reunidos todos os ingredientes para poderes embarcar nesta viagem enriquecedora e desafiante que é o mundo Deloitte?

O teu dia a dia e responsabilidades vão ser compostos por:

  • Analise de dados em várias tecnologias, SQL e No-SQL;
  • Desenho, implementação, e monitorização de pipelines ETL;
  • Criação de processos para tratamento de dados (data profiling, cleansing, masking);
  • Desenho e implementação de soluções real-time analytics;
  • Desenho e implementação de soluções Big Data;
  • Desenho e Implementação de soluções data-driven distribuídas com recurso a tecnologias Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP);
  • Colaborar com vários stakeholders na definição, tratamento de dados e implementação de modelos avançados de Machine Learning.
  • Garantir a coordenação entre equipas técnicas e funcionais no âmbito de projetos de dados;


És tu quem procuramos:

  • Formação superior nas áreas de Engenharia ou similares;
  • Conhecimento da língua Inglesa (oral e escrita) e disponibilidade para viajar; Entre 2 a 6 Anos de experiência profissional em projetos de Data;
  • Conhecimento de processos de desenvolvimento de software;
  • Experiência com metodologias Agile;
  • Conhecimentos de linguagens SQL / No SQL;
  • Conhecimentos em Python;
  • Experiência profissional em soluções ETL (exemplos, Azure Data Fabric, AWS Glue, Snowflake, SSIS, IBM DataStage) (preferencial);
  • Experiência em soluções da Data Visualization (exemplos, Power BI, Tableau);
  • Experiência profissional com Data Warehouses / Data Lakes;
  • Conhecimento das soluções Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP) orientadas a arquiteturas de dados distribuídos;
  • Experiência profissional em soluções/tecnologias Big Data (exemplos, Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, ELK, MongoDB) (preferencial);
  • Orientação para o cliente e para resultados;
  • Comunicação, trabalho em equipa, resolução de problemas e capacidade analítica.


Desenvolve uma carreira à tua medida

  • Num contexto de trabalho diverso que permite um desenvolvimento e aprendizagem contínuos
  • Através de um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira personalizado (skills/ oportunidades técnicas e funcionais), adequado ao momento, às tuas necessidades e objetivos
  • Participando em projetos nacionais e internacionais, com dimensão e impacto relevante nesta área de especialização
  • Acesso ilimitado às maiores plataformas de aprendizagem online (Linkedin Learning e Udemy
  • Oportunidade de formações e certificações nas mais recentes tecnologias, nomeadamente em tecnologias Cloud

  • Uma cultura de inovação e excelência que nos torna líderes e precursores de tendências
  • Um ambiente amigável, de respeito, confiança, transparência e informalidade
  • Uma rede para a vida que te faz estar ligado ao melhor conhecimento ao lado de líderes e especialistas

Na Deloitte, nunca trabalharás sozinho. Vais integrar os mais variados e desafiantes projetos e fazer parte do nosso Global Solutions Center, onde poderás colaborar de forma integrada com outras equipas da rede global Deloitte. Terás sempre alguém ao teu lado para te inspirar, ajudar e desafiar a expandir os teus horizontes, enquanto exploras soluções tecnológicas diferenciadoras. Aqui, ao encontrares um ambiente dinâmico, colaborativo e humano, terás a oportunidade de desenvolver a tua melhor versão.

Além disso, as nossas equipas em Portugal têm projeção internacional, o que demonstra a nossa forte liderança global em diversas expertises tecnológicas.

Se tens interesse em explorar e desenvolver as tuas competências e fazer parte de equipas que desenvolvem soluções nas tecnologias líderes de mercado, então estás no lugar certo!

Somos mais de 5.500 pessoas em Portugal, das quais mais de 2.600 trabalham em áreas tecnológicas, a partir de escritórios e Digital Studios em Lisboa, Porto, Viseu, Coimbra e Faro e de polos tecnológicos em Braga, Setúbal e Leiria.

Title: Global Equities - Cash Equities - Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


BNP Paribas’ Global Markets business offers a broad range of products and services in the global interest rates, credit, currency, equities & commodity markets. Global Markets help their franchise of clients find effective ways to raise and invest capital as well as manage their exposure to risk


Your Main Activities Are


The job combines a strong focus on Research Production (models, publishing, distribution, marketing), front office teams support, research database/referential administration, data and system controls. This includes the relationship with local IT and support/ops teams, as well as Global research management
The responsibilities are fulfilled through close collaboration with the rest of Team Data
Main areas of responsibilities are:
Data & Referential Administration:
Data and repository administration management, liaising with EMEA team:
Daily monitoring and controls on market data:
Check daily processes on closing market data worldwide
Manual updates of closing prices, cross, rates, etc
Follow-up of Corporate Actions, application of coefficients on the relevant stocks
Maintenance of benchmarks and their price history
Maintenance of samples and baskets of stocks
Daily monitoring and controls on static data (repository)
Referential administration (users’ arrival & departure, stocks…)
Data updates on demand (historical prices, benchmarks…)
Data analysis and bespoke requests
Operational and functional support:
Production and functional support for analysts/sales:
Acting as an expert on tools (best practices, key features, but also issues management & liaising with IT support and platform team)
Second level support on all research production tools. And escalate issues to IT Dev and or BA team, and follow them until they are solved
Research & Sales Requests” management
First point of contact for the business on any request or issue, routing to the relevant team if needed (e.g. central IT or IT Support)
Follow-up of any request received (ticketing system) from end to end, in relation with the development teams if needed
This can include among other peer group creation (valuation), website scrapping requests (alternative data), new models creation, user rights management, CRM virtual meetings support, webinar creation and organisation…
Teamwork in a continuous improvement of service quality:
Writing and updating of operational procedures
Activity meetings and reporting

Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor's degree in IT or Finance
At least 2 years of relevant experience in IT or Finance
Fluency in English both oral and written (mandatory)
Knowlege in:
Financial Markets
Finance and Equities
Office Pack
VBA, Tableau, SQL, Bloomberg
Ability to deliver / Results driven
Critical Thinking
Communication skills - oral & written
Ability to collaborate / team work
Ability to develop and adapt a process
Ability to set up relevant performance indicators

About The Team


BNP Paribas Exane is the Cash Equities business of BNP Paribas Global Markets. Equity Research operates within Cash Equities. Our team of research analysts are client-facing, produce fundamental analysis, review key industry trends, and provide stock recommendations on the companies we analyse. Analysts share these views with our Institutional Investor client base through a variety of communication channels
“Team Data” operates within BNP Paris Exane Equity Research and is looking for a person for managing the Cash Equity IT Advisory platform and supporting the research teams which are expanding significantly in terms of headcounts, volumes, and activity in EMEA, APAC and in the USA


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: ETL Developer (IBM Datastage)
Description:
Job Description



Job Description : We are currently looking for developers profile (AD2/AD3), to be allocated on a transversal squad/dev team and dedicated to maintain and support our transversal framework on Data factory.


Data Factory is a key program that will deliver a Data Aggregation and Curation platform, based on a relational database and an ETL for modern and efficient data loading, transformation and control. This aim is to create a unique centralised repository with a copy of operational and referential data, where all data are consolidated and harmonised, and where data quality is qualified as fit for purpose.


These positions will work in an environment where the scopes of the technologies used in the projects will tend to grow.


These positions will be for ETL developers on technologies, such as IBM Datastage PX and SQL, will provide user support and be trained on the technologies eligible. In this role the candidate must be able to set up the environment before development, perform, document and record the necessary tests to provide acceptance evidences to the client.


Main Responsibilities:





Participate in an ETL development cycle (Analysis, development, testing and deployment), mainly in IBM Datastage PX and SQL
Ensure unit-testing, integration testing, automatic testing (mainly with Octane, quality center or other similar tools q)
Ensure the application of the good technological and methodological practices recommended
Identify innovative ideas and proof of concepts according to project requirements
Ensure maintenance and level 3 support of the application portfolio
Acquire functional and/or technical expertise on the key elements of the application and/or technological portfolio
Challenge business and/or technical requirements
Contribute on technical solution definition
Develop and customize enablers components Datastage components
Monitor performance and rectifying related issues.
Deliver projects with quality




Nice to have:


Experience with REST APIs and Service/events oriented architecture
Working with DevOps tools : Jenkins; git ; ansible
Experience in Agile context (like Kanban, Lean or SCRUM)






Qualifications



Technical skills:


IBM Datastage PX and/or other similar ETL tools
SQL development skills (Oracle is the DB used)
PL/SQL development skills
Experience with GIT and Jenkins
Experience with Shell scripting, Unix/Linux
Experience in documenting bug reports, tickets, and code changes
Technical analysis and documentation
English (read, spoken, written - C level minimum)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re the world’s leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Worldpanel provides brands and retailers with a unique, 360-degree understanding of consumer behaviour across the globe. We are shopper-centric, continuously monitoring the purchase and usage behaviour through the largest omnipanel in the world. With unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology and expert analysts, we partner with brands and retailers of all sizes, empowering them to reimagine what’s possible, and change the landscape to create a better, healthier, more sustainable and inclusive world.

Job Details

INSPIRE SUCCESSFUL DECISIONS

Kantar’s Worldpanel division is searching for a methodical and inquisitive Statistical Data Analyst to join our Global Data Modelling and Methodology Team. Based in Lisbon, Portugal this is an incredible opportunity to be part of our exciting vision for the future!

Role’s Mission

We’re currently looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our global Data Modelling and Methodology team engaged in delivering a key global big data processing platform for Worldpanel – a key element of our business strategy.

This is a Global role within our statistical methodology team. Expect to be dedicated to researching and developing statistic models to correct biases and weaknesses of our data panels (starting with our core take-home panels in Europe). You'll regularly interact with global and local data quality teams, local production teams, as well as the data product team.

This newly established role is mostly related to data calculation – meaning designing new measures and Everyday Analytics Solutions (EDA) to enhance the benefits of Prism Factory & MyWorldpanel* all over the world.
