Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek 🚀, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe 🌎 supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




🇵🇹 Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center – Sodexo Business Services – SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Data Analyst




Group Internal Audit (GIA) is an independent and objective function that provides assurance and consulting services to the management and the board of directors of Sodexo. GIA aims to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the governance, risk management and control processes of the group, and to contribute to the achievement of its strategic objectives.




The purpose of the data analyst role is to provide meaningful data and conclusions which will be the basisof making informed decisions during the audit process. As audits have become more remote in nature, the audit process has become more reliant on a risk-based approach driven by upfront data analysis which allows for a focusing of the audit scope and gaining efficiencies throughout the audit process. This role is critical in the planning phase of each audit (Global scope) to ensure a successful completion of audit objectives while maintaining assurance that General Data Protection Regulations are followed while in support of global audits/projects.




As a data analyst, you will be part of the GIA data analytics team, which supports the audit missions and projects by providing data-driven insights and solutions. You will be responsible for:







⚙ What will you do?

Collaborating with the audit teams to understand their needs and expectations, and to provide them with data analytics support and recommendations.
Collecting, processing and analyzing data from various sources and systems, using tools such as SQL, Power BI, Python, R, Tableau, etc.
Designing, developing and maintaining dashboards, reports and visualizations that communicate relevant and actionable information to the audit teams and stakeholders.
Identifying, assessing and monitoring key risks and controls, using data analytics techniques such as descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive analytics.
Performing data quality checks and ensuring data integrity and reliability.
Staying abreast of the latest trends and developments in data analytics and sharing best practices and knowledge within GIA.




🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

A bachelor's or master's degree in data science, computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering, or a related field.
At least 3 years of relevant experience in data analytics, preferably in an internal or external audit environment.
Strong skills in data manipulation, analysis and visualization, using tools such as SQL, Power BI, Python, R, Tableau, etc.
A good understanding of the audit methodology and the risk and control framework.
A high level of curiosity, creativity and problem-solving ability.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to work effectively in a multicultural and dynamic team.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.
A willingness to travel occasionally, both nationally and internationally




🎉 What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there’s a constant need to be innovative.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there’s always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now, and support the decision about what are the next steps.

Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Businesses.

Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.

Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis.
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems.
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations.
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management.
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.



What are we looking for?


Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or Matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.



Personal traits:

Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients

Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy

Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included

Willingness to collaborate with other players

Strong communication skills

Your role involves working with large datasets to identify trends, generate insights, and provide actionable recommendations to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance overall supply chain performance.

Your Responsibilities


Data Collection & Management:
Gather, clean, and maintain large datasets related to logistics operations, including transportation, warehousing, inventory, and supply chain performance.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by performing regular audits and data validation checks.
Data Analysis:
Analyze logistics data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to present data insights to stakeholders.
Utilize statistical tools and software to interpret data and provide actionable insights.
Performance Monitoring:
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) related to logistics activities, such as delivery times, transportation costs, inventory levels, and order accuracy.
Identify areas of inefficiency and recommend process improvements to optimize logistics operations.
Reporting:
Prepare regular and ad-hoc reports for management, highlighting key findings, trends, and areas for improvement.
Communicate complex data clearly and concisely to non-technical stakeholders.
Collaboration:
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including supply chain, operations, and IT, to ensure data-driven decision-making across the organization.
Collaborate with IT to improve data collection methods and tools and to implement new analytics solutions.
Process Improvement:
Identify and recommend new technologies or tools to enhance data analysis capabilities and streamline logistics processes.
Support the implementation of new systems and tools by providing data-driven insights and conducting training sessions for staff.
Compliance & Risk Management:
Ensure compliance with industry regulations and company data handling and reporting policies.
Identify potential risks in logistics operations based on data analysis and suggest mitigation strategies.


Your Skills And Experiences


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Logistics, Supply Chain Management, or a related field.
Proven experience (2+ years) in data analysis, preferably within a logistics, supply chain, or transportation environment.
Proficiency in data analysis tools like SQL, Excel, Python, R, or other statistical software.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
Knowledge of logistics and supply chain concepts and best practices is highly desirable.


Preferred Skills:


Experience with ERP systems, transportation management systems (TMS), or warehouse management systems (WMS).
Familiarity with machine learning or predictive analytics in a logistics context.
Advanced Excel skills (macros, pivot tables, complex formulas).

Title: Marketing Analyst - Customer Data Analyst
Description:
We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Marketing Analyst - Customer Data Analyst

Who We Are

FedEx is the largest express transportation company in the world, connecting more than 220 countries and territories. We work every moment to deliver the most important package of someone’s day. Our team of passionate people know their day-to-day work is invaluable in delivering outstanding experience to our customers. 530,000 team members strong, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We love what we do, and we do it well. Our reach is big, and so are our dreams. Join us and let's write our next chapter together.

What You Will Be Doing


Analyze Customer Data: Collect, analyze, and interpret customer data from various sources (e.g., CRM systems, web analytics, social media) using tools like SAS, Alteryx, and Databricks to identify trends, behaviors, and insights that drive engagement strategies.
Develop Audience Segmentation: Create and manage detailed audience segments based on customer data, using platforms such as Relay42 to tailor marketing strategies and campaigns to specific customer groups.
Support Marketing Automation: Develop and manage data-driven marketing automation strategies, including segmentation, lead scoring, and personalized campaigns, to enhance customer engagement and conversion rates.
Create and Maintain Dashboards: Design and maintain dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights into customer engagement metrics, campaign performance, and overall marketing effectiveness, utilizing visualization tools and data platforms.
Monitor and Optimize Campaign Performance: Track and analyze the performance of marketing automation campaigns, including those run through Relay42, providing insights and recommendations for optimization based on data analysis using SAS, Alteryx, and Databricks


What Do You Bring With You


Expertise in Data Analysis Tools: Proficiency in data analysis tools and platforms such as SAS, Alteryx, Databricks, SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI to analyze and present data.
Experience with Marketing Automation Platforms: Knowledge of marketing automation tools such as Relay42, HubSpot, Marketo, or Salesforce Marketing Cloud, including experience with setting up and managing automated workflows and campaigns.
Audience Creation and Management: Experience in creating and managing audience segments, leveraging data-driven insights to inform targeted marketing strategies and improve engagement.
Strong Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret complex data sets, identify patterns, and provide actionable insights that drive customer engagement and marketing effectiveness.
Communication and Reporting: Excellent skills in creating clear, concise reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Excellent interpersonal & communication skills with the ability to interact effectively throughout various functional groups and hierarchical levels


Excellent knowledge of English is a must (working language)

What Do We Offer


Attractive compensation package
Training to get you started and on-the-job learning opportunities
Extensive learning resources to further develop your skills and knowledge
Tuition Assistance Program (*applicable for FedEx positions with a permanent contract)
Employee Assistance Program for you and your family in difficult life situations
Employee reduced-rate shipping
Great career opportunities
FedEx is one of the worlds most admired companies and trusted brands year after year


Bring your ideas, individuality, and dreams to our global community. Feel good about where you work. Choose your career path - we’re ready to invest in your development. Join FedEx.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
We are hiring freelance Portuguese speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.




This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.




Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & Portuguese
You must be living in Portugal for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Portugal
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.




Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: mid level

Type of position: hybrid

The amazing you, will have:




3+years experience working with data;
Proficiency in SQL (Crud, data models, transactionality, tuning);
Knowledge about multidimensional modeling concepts;
Strong data analysis skills;
TDD\BDD knowledge;
Knowledge of Continuous Delivery/Continuous Integration, Delivery, and Deployment through CI Pipelines;
Good English level.







To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you´ll have (plus):

Good French level

Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
